text: Alibek Sultanovich Delimkhanov () (born October 16, 1974) is a Chechen colonel, military commander of the Kadyrovtsy Spetsnaz battalion Sever (North). Zaur Dadaev, a former second-in-command to Alibek Delimkhanov, confessed that he had decided to kill Boris Nemtsov because of his criticism of Islam and Ramzan Kadyrov, according to Russian media. == References == == External links == Category:1970 births Category:Deputy prime ministers of Chechnya Category:Fugitives wanted on murder charges Category:Living people Category:Members of the State Duma (Russian Federation) Category:Chechen people
title: Alibek Delimkhanov
